content:
Diagnosis:	Endometrial cancer - Grade 1 endometrioid adenocarcinoma, FIGO stage IA

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Total laparoscopic hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

Histology:	Grade 1 endometrioid adenocarcinoma, FIGO stage IA. Depth of invasion 2mm in 14mm wall. LVSI negative. PTEN loss and MLH1 methylation detected.

I reviewed [redacted name] today for her end of treatment assessment following completion of her surgical management for early stage endometrial cancer. She has made an excellent recovery from her surgery with complete resolution of her previous abnormal bleeding. Her post-operative period was uncomplicated and her wound sites have healed well.

On examination today, the vault appears well-healed with no concerning features. She reports no pelvic pain or pressure symptoms. Her mobility has returned to baseline and she has resumed her usual daily activities including regular walking.

Given the final histology showing Grade 1 disease with minimal myometrial invasion, negative LVSI status, and clear surgical margins, no adjuvant treatment is indicated. I have explained that her prognosis is excellent with very low risk of recurrence.

The plan is for clinical follow-up every 4 months for the first two years. I have provided written information about potential symptoms of recurrence and contact details for the CNS team. She understands to report any new vaginal bleeding, unexplained pelvic pain, or other concerning symptoms.

We will see her for her next follow-up appointment in 4 months' time. A CT chest/abdomen/pelvis will be arranged for her 1-year surveillance point as per protocol.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: PTEN loss and MLH1 methylation detected

status_updates.value: Early stage endometrial cancer treated with surgery alone. Excellent recovery with very low risk of recurrence based on favorable pathological features
Complete resolution of abnormal bleeding following surgery
No adjuvant treatment indicated given favorable pathological features
Clinical follow-up every 4 months for first two years
